alert.note: Alert for Berrien; Branch; Cass; Hillsdale; St. Joseph (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 21 at 6:10AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: Much warmer weather today and Tuesday will cause any remaining snow to melt. Additional rainfall tonight into Tuesday will combine with this melted snow to bring additional or renewed flooding on a number of rivers and isolated flooding of a number of county roads where ice has melted. The combination of the runoff of the melted snow and the additional rainfall should total around one inch or more if higher rainfall amounts are realized. This will either prevent flood waters from receding or will bring renewed flooding to rivers and flooded areas from late last week. River forecasts will be continually updated with the latest information this week as flooding is likely to persist through Friday. Some county and some secondary roads are likely to be affected throughout the week as additional runoff exacerbates the situation. Much colder air will return Thursday causing grounds and standing water to freeze. This outlook means that rises on rivers and streams may occur or have already occurred. Potential impacts are possible, but not yet certain. There also may be some ponding on area roads Tuesday. If you live in areas prone to flooding, monitor the latest forecasts and statements, including possible flood watches and warnings.

area.areaDesc: Berrien; Branch; Cass; Hillsdale; St. Joseph
